isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL 4X2 AND 6X4 SPRING SUSPENSION WITH TORQUE RODS - MAINTENANCE

svcproc.title: MAINTENANCE
svcproc.para: Since the suspension requires no lubrication, maintenance is limited to periodic inspection, and inspection at regular maintenance intervals. To insure torque values are maintained, and proper spring end clearance exists, spring ends must not be in contact with sides of equalizer ( Figure 3). Spring end contact indicates that spring assemblies are not seated on axle housing or there is a need for suspension alignment. Check U-bolt seats, U-bolts, spring assemblies, etc. for proper installation. Refer to SPECIFICATIONS. If suspension alignment is required, refer to GROUP 03 SPRING SUSPENSION ALIGNMENT in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
